name: Novotel Eindhoven

reviews.text: It was a surprisingly pleasant experience to stay at the Novotel Eindhoven. We didn't expect much from a hotel that was to serve as a stopover on a long drive from Scandinavia to England. But upon leaving we actually thought that we could have spent a short holiday in this place!
reviews.title: Surprisingly pleasant experience

reviews.text: The hotel is modern, clean and stylish and the staff was extremely helpful, from the reception to the restaurant. And like most Dutch people, they all spoke brilliant English.
reviews.title: Novatel

reviews.text: We had two adjoining rooms facing the large garden, and even though the hotel is right by a highway, we felt a bit like we had come to a countryside retreat. The rooms very excellent, the beds comfy and the shower rooms modern and clean. The garden has a pool, which was closed because of the season, but there was a small playground, which our kids enjoyed. The garden leads into a forest area which provided plenty of opportunity for some decent hide and seek.
reviews.title: Breakfast issues

reviews.text: There is also a very small "kids corner" indoors, which has building blocks, as well as a couple of computers with games, but we didn't get to use them.
reviews.title: Perfect airport hotel

reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening, but had a very nice dinner in the hotel restaurant. They even offered a healthy kids' meal. The breakfast was equally good, and didn't feature too many unhealthy options to steer the kids away from.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: It's a very comfortable hotel: I got there by car and I found a free parking at my disposal. All the staff was polite and professional. My double room was huge and well equipped. There was a nice swimming pool in the garden, very useful if you want to chill out after a long journey. I reserved on line and the fare for the room was a bargain: 86 euros per night. On the contrary, the restaurant was a bit expensive: 43 euros for two caesar salades and two bottles of still mineral water...it looks to me exaggerated (probably they keep high prices, taking advantage of the isolated position). The hotel is located in the middle of nowhere: only Eindhoven Airport is very close (approximately something more than a mile). So, if you need to stay near the airport because an early flight in the morning or a late arrival in the night, I absolutely recommend a stop over in this hotel, but if you are planning a longer stay in Eindhoven, you better look for a hotel in the city center.
reviews.title: Only if you need to stay close to the airport

reviews.text: Fantastic hotel, clean , spacious , great food, lovely garden with pool area. Would definatly stay again. Stayed for 1 night on the final night of our 9 night trip round germany,belgium and the netherlands and this was the nicest hotel of all the hotels we stayed in. Friendly staff who speak great english is such a bonus.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Surprisingly good
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on a business trip. Had low expectations but really enjoyed my stay. Room was clean and functional. Dinner in the restaurant was excellent, breakfast tasty. There is a lovely pool and eating area at the back, with trees all around, where you'd think you were in the country rather than right next to a major road on the outskirts of Eindhoven. And all at a good price. Finally, the staff were all attentive and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, has a bar and a restaurant, true pictures! Parking cost per night 5 euros, camera controlled area. Our room was fantastik, it had a big bed and a 2 seat couch, that converts into bed in think. New looking flat screen tv, best choice of British and European channels (30 all in all), even one Russian channel - RTR, quality of signal was nice, WiFi for free - and FAST. Minifrifge, hairdryer, safe box.Toiletries good quality, could not wish for anything else be in the room.
reviews.title: Great place, would come back!

reviews.text: Rude, no coffee at 5h45 a.m., and both morning restaurant persons rude and dissmissive, restaurant closed in evening but no one told us before we arrived, so nowhere to eat because no car in the middle of nowhere, and a bit expensive for so far from town. No bathtub. They were nice with my children. Otherwise, one positive thing was really not noisy, with even 2 doors for less noise from the hallway. But I prefer the Holliday Inn downtown for even cheaper.
reviews.title: Rude, no coffee, restaurant closed and expensive for so far from town

reviews.text: My 3 days stay at this place during a business tour was really wonderful and this was all due to this wonderful accommodation, which was booked by our company. It was a great choice. Whatever I expected for this place, it was far beyond that. Rooms were fantastic, very intelligently designed according to needs of all types of travelers. Food elegantly served and included a great variety too. And, above all the guys employed here they are really great people - professional, but very caring and very polite. I will love to visit this place again.
reviews.title: Very impressive

reviews.text: Nothing special about this hotel. I find it very expensive for what is just a motel.
reviews.title: Fairly standard Good Quality and Service

reviews.text: It's kind of stuck out in the middle of nowhere so it's a taxi ride if you what to go out in the evening.
reviews.title: Excellent stopover

reviews.text: Excellent location off the freeway and close to airport. Friendly( seems to be with all the Dutch) and excellent service. Clean room, albeit much smaller than we are used to state side, great shower, free wifi. Food was very good too. Nice outdoor amenities for the kids but essentially a business hotel. Charged 5 euro for parking / day which was a new thing not reflected on their website. If I ever have the need to go to Eindhoven again for business this would definitely be the place to be. There are similar class but pricier hotels near the downtown but more convenient to the trains and shopping
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Nice hotel, south of Eindhoven. Friendly staff.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff

reviews.text: Good free wifi, in the restaurant and also in the room.
reviews.title: Fine rooms against decent prices

reviews.text: I asked for a quit room and got it. The parking was aslo free of charge.
reviews.title: Fantastic service would give higher is I could

reviews.text: The room was spacius, had a shower, no bath. Also airco, safe, fridge, ....

description: The entirely non smoking hotel Novotel Eindhoven,enjoys a unique location in Eindhoven and is easy to reach true the A2 motorway.The hotel is close to Eindhoven Airport and a 10 minute drive from the centre of Eindhoven. All rooms feature airconditioning, WiFi and guests enjoy the convenience of free parking at the hotel. The Novotel Eindhoven is ideal for a business stay, meeting or a weekend away.Enjoy dinner in our restaurant or a drink in our bar. In summer, enjoy our terrace and heated outdoor swimming pool.
